sentences.en: He has made a terrible blunder.
He is on the watch, and fully expecting you to blunder into it.
sentences.cn: 他在旁边看着, 就盼着你往里面跳呢.

sentences.en: His blunder would certainly queer his chances of promotion.
sentences.cn: 他犯的大错肯定会毁了他晋升的机会.

sentences.en: His great abilities might have prevented many a blunder at the Fuehrer's headquarters.
sentences.cn: 他的非凡才能可能使元首大本营避免铸成许多大错.

sentences.en: I fear lest we commit an inexcusable blunder.
sentences.cn: 我为我们会犯不可原谅的错误而担忧.

sentences.en: I saw that I had been guilty of a careless blunder.
sentences.cn: 我意识到自己因疏忽而酿成大错.

sentences.en: I think he made a tactical blunder by announcing it so far ahead of time.
sentences.cn: 我认为他在时机远未成熟时就把这事说了出去是一种失策。

sentences.en: I'm afraid we must have made some blunder and given offence.
sentences.cn: 那么 说,恐怕就是我们干了点鲁莽的事,得罪人了.

sentences.en: It had been an unwitting blunder on Blair's part.
sentences.cn: 它曾是布莱尔的无心之失。

sentences.en: It was blocked by the fear of committing a blunder.
Someone has made a real blunder here.
sentences.cn: 有人在这方面出了差错.

sentences.en: The big eyes told Tom his blunder and he stopped, confused.
sentences.cn: 贝基睁大了两只眼睛望着他,汤姆这才发现自己已铸成了大错,于是他住了口, 有点不知所措的样子.

sentences.en: They blundered badly when they gave him the job.
sentences.cn: 他们犯了大错，让他做这份工作。

sentences.en: This was a blunder by Mr Baker, but it was a forgivable one.
sentences.cn: 这是贝克先生的一时疏忽，但是可以原谅。

sentences.en: Whoever fails to see this will make a big blunder.
sentences.cn: 谁要是看不到这一点就要犯极大的错误.

words.tran_cn: 轻率粗心的人；犯愚蠢错误的人

phrases.tran_cn: 一再粗心（或荒唐）地做某事；一错再错

trans.tran_cn: 犯愚蠢的错误，不慎陷入，跌跌撞撞
trans.tran_en: to make a big mistake, especially because you have been careless or stupid

trans.tran_cn: 跌跌撞撞地走， 慌乱地走； 犯错误
trans.tran_en: to move in an unsteady way, as if you cannot see properly
